direction.raw_text: . OK? Thanks. He hangs up, hands the bag back to Alwyn and steps back into... 142   INT. CIRCUS - READING ROOM - DAY                          142 Guillam retraces his steps, placing his dummy file in the pink stack, replacing the one he placed there in its original shelf, remembering to take the green slip from the bracket. It's done. Guillam takes the green slip and hands it to Sal, who signs it and puts it on its spike. Guillam turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOBY ESTERHASE is standing in front of him. Unfriendly eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could we see you Peter? For a second Guillam can't speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Percy would like quite an urgent word with you. Can you come now to the fifth floor? That would be so kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Esterhase turns and Guillam, mind whirring, follows him back out through the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might just throw that into the lift for me, mark it for the second floor, save me filling out more bloody chits?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will do sir. 143   INT. CIRCUS - FIFTH FLOOR - OUTSIDE ALLELINE'S OFFICE - DAY 143 The Mothers sit over their typewriters as Guillam and Esterhase walk through into the anteroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Esterhase, I'll have no phone calls, tell them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Chief will take no calls, please, ladies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can hear. Toby holds the door open for Guillam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are having a conference.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 144   INT. CIRCUS - CONFERENCE ROOM - DAY                         144 Alleline sits in the baronial chair, Bland at his left. Haydon on his right. Esterhase trots over to his seat. Guillam takes in the REPORT they all seem to have spread out in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well now young Peter Guillam, are you ready for me finally? Guillam, affecting ease, leans against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you getting up to down there these days, apart from chasing our virgins... Guillam catches a smirk from Esterhase - mocking him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couple of Arab ploys look quite promising. Other than that, getting quite good at ping-pong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arabs... You can rent one but you can't buy one. Right Bill? He looks up from the report. Here it comes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's Ricki Tarr these days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. We have tea at Fortnum's every afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I require the matter of your discussion with Tarr. Guillam shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell him. He'll be thrilled. Alleline lets the silence build, rather like a bad actor. Everyone is staring at Guillam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that shrug for? He SLAMS a hand on the desk, tea-cups rattling, a sudden roar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking to you about a murderer. I'm talking to you about a defector from your own damn section! I'm accusing you of consorting with an enemy agent behind my back! Don't damn well shrug at me! How'd you like a term in prison? Guillam's own temper comes to his rescue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I haven't been seeing him! So get your facts straight and get
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A moment, while the room digests this. A relaxation of the tension, as if he's passed some kind of test.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So if I told you that Tarr had recently arrived in Paris would you be surprised?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing would surprise me about Tarr.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I told you we happen to know that thirty thousand pounds mysteriously appeared in his bank account last month, would that surprise you? This DOES shock Guillam, but he manages to hold on to his sullen expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your man's a defector, Guillam. Got turned by the opposition months ago and now they've sent him back to us!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind what for! To muddy the water, that's what for! Spread a whole lot of damn nonsense to get us chasing our tails! The point is this - he's heading for home. The first peep from him you come to the grown-ups, understood? Anyone you see at this table. But not another damn soul!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 145   INT. CIRCUS - CORRIDOR - DAY                                145 Guillam is walking to the lifts, we note he is now carrying his BAG. Behind him ROY BLAND is walking down the corridor. He peels off, turning left, humming a tune to himself - the same POP SONG that was playing at the garage in the background of Guillam's call. Guillam reacts as he keeps on walking, trying to work out if this MEANS SOMETHING. We track with him as his anger and PARANOIA grow. 146   EXT. GARAGE - DAY                                           146 Guillam drives down an alleyway full speed, screeches to a halt as he reaches a group of children playing, edges past them and on into the car body repair shop. He gets and strides past the elderly GERMAN MECHANIC we saw earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's waiting for you. Guillam strides on, nerves at snapping point, to the other end of the workshop where a Vauxhall waits. Behind him the Mechanic and his SON are already beginning to strip the plates off Guillam's car. 147   EXT. GARAGE - DAY                                           147 Mendel appears by Guillam's side as they walk towards another waiting car, Guillam simmering with rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All go smoothly did it? (Beat) Where we off to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hotel. I have to see George.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Smiley isn't at the hotel, sir. Change of venue. 148   INT. CONTROL'S FLAT - DAY                                   148 Tarr sits in Control's green velvet armchair watching TV. There's a large tape recorder on the table behind him. We hear the door to the flat opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Guillam hurries into the room, stops, seeing Tarr. Tarr gives his sunny grin but he's sweating, his eyes full of tension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mister Guillam, sorry I took so long to come back. Guillam punches him in the face, drags him from the chair, the two struggling. Behind them Smiley and Fawn appear. Smiley watches coolly for a moment then signals Fawn, who drags Guillam off Tarr, expertly pinning his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, sir. Guillam pulls free angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ricki's been helping us Peter. (Indicating TAPE DECK) He's been telling us all about his adventures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Smiley) He's a double, George! There is no Mole! The whole thing's a pack of lies thought up by Moscow. Karla's bought him for thirty thousand pounds! He pulls the LOG BOOK out of his file.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To Tarr) I stole that, because of you! I spied on my own. Do you know how that makes me feel? Smiley holds out his hand for the log book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you did take the trouble to steal it... Guillam hands him the book and Smiley leafs through the pages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ricki, you said you sent the Circus a telegram concerning Irina's information? Tarr sits up, wiping blood from his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Sullenly) S'right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was the date? Tarr hesitates, considering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't know because there was no telegram! The whole thing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: November 20th. It would have been November 20th. Evening. Smiley has found the right month. He flicks through the dated pages - 18th November, 19th November... He holds up the book - the next page has been cut out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: November 20th is missing. (Beat) Someone is covering their tracks Peter. Unless you think that's just a coincidence? Guillam looks thrown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty thousand isn't so much for Karla to pay if it protects his Mole. I'm afraid someone in the Circus knows all about Mister Tarr and is doing everything they can to discredit him. Guillam takes the log book from Smiley, runs a thumb down the razored edge of the missing page. He notices some writing on the next page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Reading) "Enquiries to the fifth floor." Smiley takes the book again, examines the note.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You recognize that handwriting? (Beat) That's Toby Esterhase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 149   EXT. HOTEL ISLAY - EVENING                                  149 Smiley and Guillam pull up in front of the hotel. They sit, in weary silence, staring up at the unprepossessing building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me? That you had Tarr? Smiley looks at him. Guillam reads the look correctly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case I didn't make it out of the Circus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Secrecy is a habit. Guillam rubs his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should get some rest. And I suppose you should get your reading done. Smiley nods. Doesn't move. 150   INT. HOTEL ISLAY - SMILEY'S ROOM - NIGHT                    150 The two men are finishing off a bottle of Scotch. Unusually, Smiley is drunk - a result of the alcohol and the lack of sleep. Guillam lies on one of the single beds, staring at the PHOTOGRAPHS of the four suspects Smiley has pinned on his chessmen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to believe Tarr was lying. (Beat) All this time, thinking I'm fighting a war. It's a sham. Karla won years ago and we didn't even know it. Smiley watches Guillam, estimating how badly all of this is affecting him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I met him once. Karla. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In fifty-five. Moscow Centre was in pieces. Purge after purge. Half their Agents were jumping ship and I travelled around signing them up. Hundreds of them. Guillam raises himself up on an elbow, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of them was calling himself Gerstmann. He was on his way back to Russia, and we were pretty sure he was going to be executed. Plane had a twenty-four lay over at Delhi, and that's how long I had to convince him to come over to us instead of going home to die. Smiley stares at the room around, projecting his memory of the Delhi cell onto their present surroundings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little room...I'm sitting here...he's sitting there... He points to an EMPTY CHAIR in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Americans have had him tortured. He holds up his right hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No fingernails. It's incredibly hot. I'm very tired and all I want to do is get this over with and get back home. Things weren't going well with Ann. Guillam flinches a little, but Smiley doesn't notice, lost now in the past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I give him the usual pitch... Come to the West and we can give you a comfortable life. After questioning. Or you can catch your plane and fly home and be shot, like Bykov, Shur, Muranov... He stares at the CHAIR as if expecting an answer, and slightly drunkenly Guillam finds himself turning to the CHAIR for a response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Beat) What did he say? Smiley doesn't answer - STARES AT THE CHAIR - the silence stretching - it's all becoming a little surreal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To the chair) Think of your wife. You have a wife, don't you? I brought you some cigarettes, by the way. He mimes placing cigarettes on an invisible table, between him and the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Use my lighter. He mimes placing the lighter beside the cigarettes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "We could arrange for her to join you, we have a lot of stock to trade. If you go back, she'll be ostracised. Think of her. Think about how much she..." He breaks off in sudden impatience with himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kept harping on about the damn wife! Telling him more about me, than... Should have walked out, of course, but for some reason... it seemed important to save this one. (Beat) So I go on. "Know you're a chain-smoker, help yourself," "We're not so very different you and I.." He makes a vague "Etcetera" gesture, stares at... THE EMPTY CHAIR ... something unsettling about it, as if somehow it is acquiring the GHOSTLY PRESENCE OF KARLA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To the chair) Look, we've both spent our lives looking for the weaknesses in one another's systems. Don't you think it's time to recognise there is as little worth on your side as there is on mine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Silence. Smiley sits back, dropping the game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never said a word. Not one word. Next morning he got back on his plane, gave the pack of cigarettes back to me, untouched - this was a chain-smoker, mind - and flew off to what he presumed would be his death. He kept my lighter. It was a gift - "To George, from Ann. All my love." Guillam is still staring at the chair, a little awe-struck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was Karla? And he flew back to die rather than give in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. (Beat) And that's how I know he can be beaten. Because he's a fanatic. And the fanatic is always concealing a secret doubt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the thing. (Beat) I can't remember. He stands up, crosses to the window, embarrassed by what he has to say next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After today, Peter you have to assume they're watching you. If there's anything you need tidied up... now's the time. Guillam stares at him, realising what he's talking about. 151   INT. GUILLAM'S FLAT - NIGHT                                 151 Guillam and his boyfriend RICHARD sit at the table, Richard working his way through a stack of essays. Guillam stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nearly done. He scores a red line down a piece of work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Godsakes... I think they're all sharing the same moronic brain. He notices the way Guillam is staring at him and his smile fades. LATER: RICHARD, bewildered and upset, is packing his belongings. He walks past Guillam, stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there's someone else, you can tell me. I'm a grown-up. Guillam doesn't say anything. Richard puts the flat keys on the side table and leaves. Guillam, stares after his one time lover, heart-broken. 152   EXT. THURSGOOD SCHOOL - DAY                                 152 Prideaux's BLUE ALVIS bumps and jolts towards us across the playing fields, an exhilarated ROACH at the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time sir? Prideaux and the rest of the class stand at the "finishing line," but Prideaux is staring down to a line of beech- trees, where a MAN is walking. It's MENDEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got your specs on Jumbo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's the fellow down there? Roach stares at the stranger eagerly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he? Beggarman? Thief? Why doesn't he look this way? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't you look if you saw a bunch of boys flogging a car around a field? Doesn't he like boys? Anyone sees him again, let me know. Don't hold with odd bods hanging about. Might steal the Alvis, which is...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best car in England! They dissolve into laughter, but Roach is still anxiously watching Prideaux, noting how his expression has darkened. 153   OMITTED                                                     153 154   INT. CIRCUS - SCALPHUNTERS - POOL TABLE - DAY               154 Belinda, the deb we met earlier, is doing up her blouse. She's teary and also a little excited that men are fighting over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it! Stop it! KASPAR has Guillam pinned against the wall and is punching him. Guillam accepts the blows with a bloody grin. Something of the school yard fight about it, as the other Scalphunters gather around, ostensibly to break it, up but clearly enjoying the distraction. One of them is trying to pull Kaspar off and, caught by a blow, joins in - the fight escalating as others join in the struggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep your bloody hands off her! He kicks at Guillam, who falls. Belinda gives a shriek of alarm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ's sake, don't fight over a bit of skirt! Guillam lies on the floor taking another kick, but his face, turned to us, registers only relief. Job done. 155   EXT. CASINO - DAY                                           155 Bright morning sunshine. Smiley and Guillam walk up concrete steps of a casino building - very modern, imposing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't seen many of the boys and girls for a while, matter of fact. 156   INT. CASINO - CASINO FLOOR - DAY                           156 Smiley, Guillam and the genial JERRY WESTERBY are sat at a blackjack table. The casino is empty, a cleaner vacuums in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's the way it is, George, isn't it? When you're out, you're out. Too much of this stuff. He points to a drink on the table before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too much wampum not good for braves. How.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How. (Beat) I need to talk to you about the night Jim Prideaux was killed, Jerry. You were duty officer, weren't you? Westerby looks at them both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Control asked me to man the phones that night. Said someone was doing a special job for the service. He wanted someone from outside he could trust. If anything came in, I was to tell him and only him. 157   INT. CIRCUS - EVENING - PAST                               157 Westerby walks down the corridor. We pass OFFICES - drawers pulled open, waste paper bins standing on desks - the end of day ritual. 158   INT. CIRCUS - DUTY OFFICERS ROOM - NIGHT                   158 Westerby is following a horse race on the radio. A dirty plate in front of him. He drinks from a can of beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 159   INT. CIRCUS - DUTY OFFICERS ROOM - NIGHT                    159 Westerby is asleep. The Circus is deathly quiet, nothing stirring. Then... A PHONE BEGINS TO RING. 160   INT. CIRCUS - CONTROL'S OFFICE - NIGHT                      160 Control sits surrounded by files. A dim green lamp on his desk the only illumination. He looks ill, tense with waiting. Cigarette stubs piled in the ashtray. He listens to the solitary PHONE below him in the building. Then it is joined by a SECOND. Then a THIRD... Control listens, nerves stretched to their limit. From just outside - the sound of someone running up the wooden staircase. A knock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been a bit of a panic, sir. Control raises his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the FO resident clerk... A Hungarian news bulletin, sir. (Reading) British spy, work-name Ellis, travelling with false Hungarian papers, has attempted to kidnap an unnamed Hungarian general in Budapest. He's been shot, other arrests imminent... Control stares at him, stands unsteadily, begins to put on his coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have a brief, please? Sir? Do you want me to deny it? Controls stares at him, lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to have a brief sir? 161   INT. CIRCUS - DUTY OFFICERS ROOM - NIGHT                    161 Westerby is on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ann? I'm sorry to bother you. Is George back yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 162   INT. CASINO - CASINO FLOOR - NIGHT - PRESENT             162 Westerby and Smiley sit opposite each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You rang my house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just on the off chance you were back from Berlin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just that there'd been a bit of a crisis. She said you weren't back yet. That was it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All hell broke loose - military yelling about Hungarian tank movements on the border, Lacon and the Minister baying at the door. Thank Christ Bill Haydon turned up when he did. 163   INT. CIRCUS - NIGHT - PAST                               163 PUSHING BILL HAYDON as he walks up the corridor towards the duty room, cutting a swathe through the people gathered outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out. The room clears. Bill sits down. He pulls out all the phone lines, decisive, taking charge. Kicks the door shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to get hold of you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just picked up half a story on the ticker-tape at my club... Tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jim Prideaux's been shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Haydon goes white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me the Hungarian Embassy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir... LATER: Haydon is on the phones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go and tell your Masters what will happen if one hair on Jim Prideaux's head is damaged... He covers the receiver, turns to Westerby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get Esterhase on the phone. Tell him to pull in the Hungarian agents, anyone we're onto. Tell him to get down to the London School of Economics, sandbag some bloody students and put them on ice at Sarratt. LATER: Westerby watches Haydon on the phone from the door. Haydon listens to a voice for a moment, then hangs up. He stands, his back to Westerby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any more news on him? Haydon doesn't turn around, head bowed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill? (Beat) Oh God, is he...? For a moment it looks like Haydon won't answer but then he seems to master his emotions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to go to his flat. Clear out anything linked. 164   INT. PRIDEAUX'S FLAT - NIGHT                             164 Haydon walks around the neat rooms. A bike up on the wall, a pair of muddy climbing boots on a newspaper, waiting to be cleaned. Haydon walks past a shelf - photographs and books. He stops, picks up an unframed black and white snap from the shelf. It's a picture of HIMSELF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Haydon stands with his back to us, possibly crying. Westerby turns thoughtfully away. 165   OMITTED                                                     165 166   OMITTED                                                     166 167   INT. LONDON - WIMPY - NIGHT                                 167 Smiley and Guillam sit eating side by side at a bar, Smiley examining the hamburger - his first - doubtfully. Guillam is thinking about what he's just been told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haydon heard the news at his club? Smiley is distant...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Saville.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At one-thirty? The ticker-tape wouldn't be running. Guillam sits, mind racing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how did he know? Oh Jesus, George...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ. Haydon? How could he have known?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not him, Peter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then how did he know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he was at my house that night. With Ann. Guillam doesn't know what to say. They sit in a hideously awkward silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I quite like this. 167A   INT. SMILEY'S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT - PAST            167A The phone on the nightstand starts to ring. A woman's hand reaches into frame and picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? (beat) Oh hello Jerry. No I'm afraid George isn't back yet. In the bed beside her we see Bill Haydon. 168    EXT. LONDON STREETS - NIGHT                                 168 A black Cab pulls up at the lights. Another black cab pulls alongside it. The two drivers acknowledge each other, chatting as the lights change to RED, but in no hurry to move. An impatient woman passenger flicks a look at the passenger in the opposite cab, wanting to share this moment of passenger outrage. We see ALLELINE'S profile staring stonily ahead. We follow his cab as it peels off into a FAMILIAR street, driving towards the house where we met Polyakov. 169    EXT. HAMPSTEAD PONDS - DAY                                  169 Smiley slips into the water. It's late afternoon. Very still and calm. Very few swimmers. Smiley's head breaks the surface, dips in, breaks the surface... 170    EXT. HAMPSTEAD PONDS - DAY                                  170 Smiley sits on a platform with his back to us, drying off from his swim, looking out over the water. A MAN'S HEAD appears, swimming up to the platform through the reeds. An old QUEEN, his face almost purple with the cold. He clings to the edge of the platform for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just in case it's of interest, dear. We are observed. Old Filth in the bushes. Not very subtle but there you are...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He swims away. The wind lifts up a little, rustling the trees and bushes around the pond. We stay on Smiley, watched and alone. 171   OMITTED                                                     171 172   OMITTED                                                     172 173   OMITTED                                                     173 174   INT. SMILEY'S HOUSE - DAY                                   174 Smiley walks into his hallway, picks up the MAIL piled on the floor. He crosses to the drawing room, still looking at the mail. The door is a little ajar and through the opening we catch a FLASH of movement in the room beyond - a COUPLE in a passionate embrace, glimpsed for a moment before they disappear out of sight. We can hear what may be their love- making. And a RECORD IS PLAYING. The same CHARLIE RICH track Smiley reacted to in the Islay Hotel. Smiley stares at the mail in his hand as if unwilling to look up. He pushes open the door and moves into... 175   INT. SMILEY'S HOUSE - DAY                                   175 ... which is EMPTY. He sits in an armchair, starts opening some letters. A FIGURE walks past Smiley abruptly. Smiley doesn't look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good flight? Smiley looks up. BILL HAYDON sits in the armchair opposite in shirt and trousers, SOCKS, NO SHOES. He sips a cup of tea. No sense of having been caught in an act of adultery. 176   INT. SMILEY'S HOUSE - DAY - PAST                            176 BACK ON SMILEY ... who is now wearing a raincoat and we realise we are in fractured memories of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE PAST SMILEY Yes. Pleasant enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just passing, thought I'd call in. Ann was in bed but she insisted on getting up. She said she'll be down in a minute. Smiley glances at a half-wrapped oil painting lying against a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I'm dropping off. 177    INT. SMILEY'S HOUSE - DAY                                  177 Smiley stands in front of the muddy-looking abstract painting we saw earlier. It's now on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awful daub really but Ann expressed a liking... What's keeping her? We hold on Smiley but hear Haydon leave the room, a WHISPERED CONFERENCE in the hall between Haydon and Ann. P.O.V. - FROM THE DOOR - George with his back to us, staring fixedly at the picture, listening to the whispers behind his back. 178    OMITTED                                                    178 178A   INT. PRIDEAUX'S CARAVAN - EVENING                          178A Prideaux lies on his bed. There is a tap at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in, Roach. Roach walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought you were in sick bay? What are you... He stops, seeing the anxiety on the boy's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it, Jumbo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir there's a stranger parked down on the road. He's just sitting there. He dissolves into tears. Prideaux crouches beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright, old fella. Don't cry. Nobody ever watched like you, did they? Off you go, now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to have to leave? Prideaux stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be fine. You get back to bed. Roach wipes his eyes and leaves. As soon as the door is closed Prideaux crawls under the little chest of drawers, grimacing with pain, working an arm further in... There is a FAINT SOUND - SOMEONE ON THE STEPS OUTSIDE. With a final effort Prideaux rips his RIFLE free from its hiding place, still trailing tape, and rolls to face the door, gun in hand. Silence. Then... A KNOCK AT THE DOOR. Prideaux aims the gun... The door opens... 179   OMITTED                                                     179 180   INT. CONTROL'S FLAT - NIGHT - PAST                          180 ... to reveal Control peering out at us. He steps aside and allows a PRE-INJURY Prideaux to enter. 181   INT. CONTROL'S FLAT - NIGHT                                 181 The flat Smiley visited. Control leads Prideaux into the same room - the green armchair, surrounded by mounds of files and papers, over-flowing ashtrays, the detritus of an obsession. The FIVE PHOTOGRAPHS of FACES fixed to the CHESS PIECES before him. Control, a walking corpse, lowers himself into the armchair, motions Prideaux to take another seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You weren't followed? Prideaux sits, presuming the question is rhetorical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust no-one, Jim. Especially not in the main stream. What Hungarian identities do you still have running?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andras Benedek, Hungarian journalist based in Paris. Control nods thoughtfully. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're caught, you keep me out of it. You were acting alone, bit of Private Enterprise. Understood? Prideaux watches him, very still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've had an offer of service. A Hungarian General. Wants to come over. I want you to meet him. He has information I need, Jim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What information?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocketry. Ballistics. Bit of politics. Something in his manner alerts Prideaux.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Beat) Treasure. He has treasure. The name of the Mole Moscow Centre has planted at the top of the Circus. Prideaux's face doesn't change, but he's wondering if the rumours could be true and Control really has gone mad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a rotten apple Jim and we have to find it. Laboriously he leans forward to the CHESS SET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm   so close I can almost feel his   heart beating. I know it's one   of five men. All I want from you   is one word. He points to the PHOTOGRAPH of PERCY ALLELINE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alleline - Tinker. (Points at the next photo) Haydon - Tailor. Bland - Soldier. We drop Sailor, it's too close to Tailor. (Pointing at next photo) Esterhase - Poorman. 182   INT. PRIDEAUX'S CARAVAN - NIGHT - PRESENT                      182 Prideaux sits with his visitor - Smiley -      recalling the meeting. He's drinking vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which means I was...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were Beggarman. Smiley nods. Just a flicker of the eyes shows us that this is painful for him to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you make of it, Jim? Control's theory?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was madness. To think any one of you could have been a traitor... madness. Smiley is watching him intently - sure he's hiding something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But still you went? Risking your life for a mission you thought was absurd? Why? Prideaux doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps some part of you wanted to know if Control was right? Wanted to know if there was a Mole, who it might be? Prideaux shoots him a dangerous look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I went because Control asked me to go. It's called doing one's duty. 183   INT. BUDAPEST - TRAIN STATION - DAY - PAST                  183 Prideaux climbs off his train and walks down the platform towards us. He pauses for a moment, drawing a Hungarian newspaper from his pocket. As he does so he glances at the other passengers walking past him. TWO WOMEN and a MAN, all apparently travelling alone, the SHOES they're wearing - BROWN SUEDE BOOTS, FUR LINED BLACK PLASTIC BOOTS and the man - a pair of BLACK GALOSHES. Prideaux walks on, tapping the paper against his leg. 184   INT. BUDAPEST - GALERIA - DAY                               184 The scene from the opening of the film. The Waiter puts down Prideaux's plate, a drop of sweat from his forehead hitting the table. He looks at the droplet, fakes a smile for the Magyar, looks after the Waiter, scans the floor around him... HIS P.O.V. - There it is - one of the women is wearing the BLACK PLASTIC BOOTS. Her coat is different and she's wearing a fur hat now - but the shoes are the one thing the surveillance agents don't have time to change. Prideaux glances up at the apartment windows above, sees the old woman, starts to rise... as we CUT TO: The SHOT - ... punching into his back, Prideaux falling forward... as we CUT TO: PRIDEAUX'S P.O.V. Those shoes again, stepping in the water and blood on the floor, passing us at eye-level. Grouping and regrouping as the operation comes to an end. The noise in the background comes to us muted and very faint. Faintly, a baby is crying, an ambulance siren is wailing. Hands appear and we are rolled onto a stretcher and lifted up to chest level where we seem to FLOAT past the faces of the MAGYAR and the other Officers, smoking cigarettes by the doors, and out towards the open doors of a waiting ambulance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 185   INT. BUDAPEST - GALERIA - DAY                               185 We are slid into the back of the ambulance as though into the drawers of a morgue. And snap to BLACK. 186   INT. LUBYANKA PRISON - CELL - DAY                           186 We are looking at the back of Prideaux's head, hair damp with sweat, shoulders trembling. We PULL OUT and find Prideaux, a filthy dressing covering the wound on his back. The cell he is in has filthy, heavily padded walls, like a straitjacket. From a speaker in the ceiling comes a maddening jagged drone. Lights blaze down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you tell them? 187   INT. LUBYANKA PRISON - CORRIDOR - DAY                       187 Prideaux, in too much pain to walk, is being dragged down a brightly lit corridor towards an INTERROGATION ROOM at the far end. He is taken inside, the door closed behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything. 188   INT. THURSGOOD SCHOOL - CLASSROOM - NIGHT - PRESENT         188 Smiley stands staring at the OWL Prideaux killed, which is now stuffed, keeping guard from the top of a bookshelf. Prideaux sits at a desk drinking the vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I held on as long as I could, to give everyone else time to get the hell out of there. (Beat) Did they? Smiley seems to have been thinking about something else, looks at him, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My networks in Hungary. Did they get out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. They were blown. The story is you blew them to save your own skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Prideaux nods, makes an odd gesture as if he's about to rise, but doesn't move. His expression hasn't changed, but inside him something has just been decided.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was your last line of defence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mole. Control's crazy theory. I was going to bury that so deep, they'd never get it out of me. Which was a joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because they already knew. They wanted to know how far Control had got in his investigation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Circus gossip. Was Percy's wife still drinking, who was Bland screwing in the office. That sort of thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did they ask about me at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of them did. Smiley becomes very still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he say about me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had a cigarette lighter. Kept flashing it round for me to see. Showed me the inscription. "To George, from Ann. All my love." He reckoned after Bill's fling with her, she might want to change the inscription. Smiley doesn't flicker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Still looking to the side) I told him to go to hell. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If they had one man like Bill Haydon they could call it set and match!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was well said. They sit in silence for a moment. Smiley buttons his coat, finished here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try and put it all behind you, Jim. He makes to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gave me a cigarette. Prideaux looks down at his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jim? Prideaux still doesn't look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was my last one. 189   OMITTED                                                     189 190   OMITTED                                                     190 191   OMITTED                                                     191 192   INT. LUBYANKA PRISON - CELL - DAY - PAST                    192 A concrete bunker of a room. Prideaux is standing in a slab of watery sunshine that falls from a sky-light above. He's smoking, trying to control the tremble in his hand. PRIDEAUX P.O.V. - The patch of sunshine only extends a few yards in front of him. The rest of the room is in granite shadow. The sense of other people watching from the shadows. The sound of a door opening and someone being led in. A woman walks across the dark room and into the slab of light, blinking as she does so. It's IRINA. Her hair is loose and dishevelled about her face. A man's voice comes from further back in the darkness...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know this woman? Prideaux looks at her. Frowns. Another voice murmurs in Russian. Irina pins her hair up in the way we saw before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know her. She looks at Prideaux and gives a small polite smile, as though good manners are going to save her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... A GUARD steps out of the shadows and SHOOTS her in the head, the shot THUNDEROUS in the room. It's horribly unexpected, and Prideaux jerks backward, bewildered and appalled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell Percy Alleline what we did. 193   EXT. HOTEL ISLAY - GUILLAM'S CAR - NIGHT - PRESENT          193 P.O.V. - THROUGH WINDSCREEN ... rain lashes down, obscuring our view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know who she was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody you need concern yourself with. An unfortunate... REVERSE - we see Guillam and Smiley are sitting in the parked car in the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said when he got out, when he was being debriefed at the Nursery, he had a visitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby Esterhase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 194   EXT. SARRATT - DAY - PAST                                  194 ... Prideaux stands watching a small, dapper figure crossing the grounds towards him - TOBY ESTERHASE. A man who's come up in the world. 195   EXT. HOTEL ISLAY - GUILLAM'S CAR - NIGHT - PRESENT         195 SMILEY He gave him a thousand pounds. Told him he was dead now and couldn't come back. Had to become a Lotus Eater - forget everything that happened - Control's theory, Tinker, Tailor... all of it. Guillam stares at him, ALERT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's what I thought. How on earth did Esterhase hear about "Tinker, Tailor?" 196   EXT. HOTEL ISLAY - NIGHT                                   196 Smiley gets out of the car, into the rain. Looks around him, uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you watch my back, Peter? Look out for a solo. Just a feeling I've had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, George. I'll watch. Guillam watches as Smiley heads off into the gloom. 197   INT. HOTEL ISLAY - SMILEY'S ROOM - NIGHT                   197 Smiley stares at the CHESS BOARD - a complex pattern of related figures. He turns back to the tape-deck, puts the headphones on, presses play:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What exactly did Irina say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said there was a General, work-name Polyakov who was stationed in London. And that Polyakov's real job was to service the mole. He meets him regularly and takes back information the Mole gives him for Karla. Smiley presses STOP. He presses RE-WIND, watches the tape spool BACKWARDS. He goes too far, presses FAST-FORWARD, watches the tape REVERSE DIRECTION. And, at this moment, we can tell from his expression, a piece of the jig-saw falls into place. 198   OMITTED                                                  198 199   INT. MINISTERIAL MEETING ROOM - DAY                      199 Lacon and Smiley are meeting with the MINISTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This meeting is not taking place. Is that clear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfectly, Minister. (Beat) There is a house, somewhere in this city, where Alleline and the others meet Witchcraft's London representative. I need the address of that house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about. Smiley stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know the address. And I fail to see the... I thought Lacon had made it clear to you, keep your nose bloody-well out of Witchcraft's business!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Lacon's advice I'm following. (To Lacon) You told me to follow in Control's footsteps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Snapping) Well, I wouldn't consider that sound advice, after the bloody mess Control left us with. It's taken Alleline - and, if I may say so, myself - this long to get us back into the race.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you take some of the credit. Lacon glances sharply at Smiley - there's something different about him, his tone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man Alleline and the others meet is called Polyakov. You believe his role is to bring information from Witchcraft to you. His real role is to receive information from the Mole to take back to Karla. He has the Minister's full attention now. A long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's... that's not possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Made possible. By you. When he steals our secrets he does it under the very nose of the Circus, in the house which you persuaded the treasury to pay for. I'm sure you'll be able to take full credit for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Appalled) Witchcraft's intelligence is genuine! It's been gold!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just enough glitter, amongst the chicken-feed. Control didn't believe in miracles and he didn't believe in Witchcraft. But you were lazy and you were greedy and so you hounded him out of the Circus and you let Karla in. His voice is still calm, but it's clear what's different now. There's a quiet fury in him. The Minister is ashen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God... We can't be made to look like fucking fools again! Forget Europe, if we have the black men getting to hear about this on Walla-Wallah News! What if we find the Mole and we move him sideways, some department where he can't do any harm? Is the Kremlin likely to boast about this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not in their interests sir. They need the Enemy to look like a threat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, tell them to play the game. We don't go crowing about their fuck-ups! In their panic, both men are addressing each other, momentarily forgetting Smiley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are not the prize. We're the bait. They turn to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've opened negotiations to exchange intelligence with the Americans. What they tell the Circus, they'll be telling the Kremlin. Witchcraft's information, the "gold" Karla let you have? It wasn't to lure you. It was to lure the Americans. Now, do you want to take credit for that? Lacon and the Minister stare at Smiley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have one thing the Mole wants. 200   OMITTED                                               200 97. 201   INT. CONTROL'S FLAT - DAY                                   201 CLOSE on a belligerent Tarr, confidence regained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I want your word you'll get Irina back. Don't care who you have to trade. I want a family. Don't wanna end up like you lot... He looks at Smiley, then he gives Guillam a knowing look, as though deliberately provoking him. Guillam absorbs the slur but his eyes are hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna live in Paris out of your hair. You'll get her back? Again a flash of the coldness in Smiley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do my utmost, Ricki. 202   INT./EXT. CIRCUS - DAY                                      202 ON LIFT DOORS: The doors open to reveal TOBY ESTERHASE, chatting to a JANITOR. ESTERHASE'S P.O.V. Guillam, standing by his car - holding the door open. 203   EXT. LONDON STREETS - GUILLAM'S CAR - DAY                   203 Guillam is driving. The radio is on. The car pulls up on the roadside and two people climb in the back. It's Smiley and Fawn. Guillam speeds off. Nobody speaks. Esterhase sits stiff, mind-whirring, uncomfortably aware of Fawn's unsettling presence behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 204   EXT. ABANDONED AIRFIELD - DAY                               204 TRACKING SHOT - PUSHING ESTERHASE ... as he stumbles through the muddy airfield. A vast, empty space all around. Toby starts to turn, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep walking please. Toby stumbles on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to talk about loyalty Toby. Control recruited you when you were trying to escape from Hungary didn't he? A wanted man. Saved you from a KGB bullet, didn't he? And yet, when the time came, when it came to picking sides between him and Alleline, you didn't hesitate? Understandable perhaps, with your war experience. You've survived this long, I suppose, because of your ability to change sides, serve any Master? Faintly we hear the low drone of an approaching engine. Esterhase scans the horizon, locks on the black speck in the sky - an aircraft flying towards them. Esterhase watches the approach with mounting anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What... what's this about George?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's about which Master you've been serving, Toby. 205   INT. CIRCUS - DAY - PAST                                    205 A FILE is placed in a briefcase - we can see now that the hands in the frame belong to Esterhase. He checks the corridor is clear... 206   EXT. ABANDONED AIRFIELD - DAY - PRESENT                     206 ... as he and Guillam drive Esterhase on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Intelligence has been leaked, Toby. Someone's been taking files from the Circus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 207    INT. CIRCUS - GROUND-FLOOR LOBBY - DAY - PAST               207 Esterhase leaving the Circus, Bryant politely wishing him good night. 208    EXT. ABANDONED AIRFIELD - DAY - PRESENT                     208 ... eyes fixed on the plane as it roars down towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a mistake George, this is all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The files were delivered to a Russian attache, weren't they? 209    INT. SAFE HOUSE - MEETING ROOM - EVENING - PAST             209 ... Esterhase holding up the documents for Polyakov to photograph. Whir... Click.... 210    EXT. ABANDONED AIRFIELD - DAY - PRESENT                     210 TOBY ESTERHASE Yes. And yes, I delivered them. 211    EXT. SAFE HOUSE - DAY - PAST                                211 Alleline getting out of the cab by the railings... the dog barking from inside the house...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... but so did Percy... 211A   INT. SAFE HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - NIGHT                     211A Haydon walking past Mrs McCraig and heading up the stairs to the empty room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and Bill... 211B   INT. SAFE HOUSE - MEETING ROOM - DAY                       211B Roy Bland sits in front of Polyakov, holding up the documents for Polyakov to photograph - Whir... Click....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Roy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 212   EXT. ABANDONED AIRFIELD - DAY - PRESENT                  212 Esterhase can't tear his eyes away from the propeller plane descending onto the runway ahead of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things aren't always what they seem. You know that George. Moscow thinks Polyakov's working for them, so, every now and then we give him the odd file to take back to them, just chicken-feed, keep his bosses happy. But Polyakov's our Joe, part of a big operation...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Operation Witchcraft? Yes, I know. Esterhase stops, turns to look at Smiley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are we here? Why are we...? Guillam gives him a sudden VIOLENT SHOVE in the back. Esterhase straightens himself, runs a palm through his hair, real fear on his face now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't... I don't deserve this. I don't deserve this George!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who gave you the message for Jim to forget about Tinker Tailor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bland!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To get rid of Connie Sachs? Westerby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bland or Haydon. I don't remember. One of them. Maybe Percy. I don't know who.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just the messenger? Running between them all. Anything to serve Witchcraft? Esterhase flinches again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know all about your secret source. And I know something you don't. I know who he is.(Beat) He's Karla. Esterhase turns to look at them in horror. Guillam pushes him again. The plane has taxied to a halt ahead of them. Unmarked. Something sinister about it. 213   OMITTED                                                     213 214   INT. SAFE HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - DAY - PAST                 214 ... in the London House, spools turning. We hear the familiar Click... Whir of Polyakov's camera... 215   INT. SAFE HOUSE - MEETING ROOM - DAY                        215 Polyakov is photographing... nothing. The table in front of him is empty, the shooting just a pantomime for the microphone above. As he continues to shoot we see the Mystery man sitting across the table from him. He takes out a canister of developed film and passes it to Polyakov.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of you has been giving Polyakov the Crown Jewels. 216   EXT. ABANDONED AIRFIELD - DAY - PRESENT                     216 ... standing on the airfield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know. I swear I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you still a wanted man, Toby? Toby looks back at the plane, almost hysterical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You picked the wrong side, Toby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George, you've got to believe me. I would never... I'm loyal, George. I'm loyal! Smiley watches him cry for a moment, his face impassive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me the address. Where do you meet Polyakov? 217   EXT. SAFE HOUSE - DAY                                      217 A terrace of flat-fronted nineteenth century houses one of them the house we have already visited. A CAR draws up before one of them and Smiley, Fawn and Guillam get out and head for the front door. 218   INT. SAFE HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR                             218 The men are fanning out, Fawn and Guillam heading into the kitchen. Smiley walks upstairs, dogged by the HOUSEKEEPER - MRS McCRAIG - not at all happy with the invasion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are the safety signals?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an air duct. Open and all's well. Closed and you're not to enter. 219   INT. SAFE HOUSE - MEETING ROOM - DAY                       219 They enter the EMPTY ROOM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is the mike, Mrs McCraig? She points at the candelabra.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what's the procedure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whenever the gentlemen are meeting I record the session. The tapes are sent back to the Circus. From downstairs come the crash of furniture being moved, rooms searched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are they doing? They shouldn't be moving things! The authority in Smiley's voice stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're at all worried you can call Lacon from the basement phone. Let's try the tape recorder shall we? 220   INT. SAFE HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - DAY                        220 CLOSE ON TAPE RECORDER   - SPOOLS SLOWLY REVOLVING Over the RECORDER we can hear GUILLAM'S VOICE reciting something from childhood, from the room above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy stood on the burning deck whence all but he had fled. The flame that lit the battles wreck, shone round him o'er the dead... Smiley is listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Yet beautiful and bright he stood... 221   EXT. PARIS - STREET - EVENING                               221 Establishing shot of a street in Paris. A squat Yorkshireman - MACKELVORE - walks out of a nearby restaurant and gets into a car. Out of nowhere Tarr suddenly appears, climbing into the passenger side, ramming a gun into his side. 222   INT. PARIS - APARTMENT - PARIS RESIDENCY - NIGHT            222 Mackelvore leads Tarr into a grand but dilapidated apartment. An elderly FRENCHMAN - ex-Resistance - looks up from his evening meal as the two pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guest from London Station, Monsieur Fourcade. The Frenchman grunts a greeting, turns back to his supper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whole service is looking for you, Ricki. They'll skin you alive if they find you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I want them to find me. Mackelvore frowns. They reach a door which he opens to reveal a STEEL DOOR beyond. He presses a bell and a hatch in the door slides open and a young man's face appears. This is BEN. He slides open a bolt, a double lock, and lets them into a ... 223   INT. PARIS - CYPHER ROOM - NIGHT                           223 MACKELVORE You can go home now, Ben. Leave the books where they are and put the keys into the machines. I'll be talking to London presently under my own steam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay boss. Tarr takes out his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben stays here. 224   INT. PARIS - CYPHER ROOM - NIGHT                           224 Tarr stands over Mackelvore, who is sending a message to the Circus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ricki Tarr claims to have further information vital to the safeguarding of the Circus. 225   INT. LONDON - TAILOR'S SHOP NEAR CIRCUS - NIGHT            225 A dark workroom. WE TRACK through a crowd of TAILORS DUMMIES. Some of the dummies are draped in clothes, some just shapes in the darkness. As though we are moving through A ROOM FULL OF SPIES. By a great domed window, occasionally washed with yellow from the traffic outside, we find MENDEL, his back to us staring out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MENDEL'S P.O.V. - THE CIRCUS ACROSS THE ROAD. A taxi pulls up a few yards away from the circus doors. We see a man clamber out. It's Percy Alleline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tinker... 226   INT. SAFE HOUSE - LISTENING ROOM - NIGHT                    226 Smiley sits on an armchair, lit by a harsh over-head light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's he look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Busy. Smiley puts the receiver on the arm of the chair, takes off his shoes and in his stocking feet crosses the room. As he does so he spools out a WASHING LINE, tying it to the far door knob. 227   EXT. SAFE HOUSE - TOW PATH - NIGHT                          227 Guillam, waits on the tow-path looking back at the house. Someone, presumably Smiley, is moving through the house, turning the lights off until it is in complete darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tailor... A torch light flashes once from a downstairs window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here comes Soldier... 228   INT. SAFE HOUSE - LISTENING ROOM - NIGHT                    228 Smiley sits in the darkness holding the phone to his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full house. 229   INT. PARIS - CYPHER ROOM - NIGHT                            229 The three men stand over the silent cypher machine. Tarr's gun rammed into his belt. Tarr is almost glittering with nerves. Then the machine clatters into life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read it aloud. Ben starts to read, his high, rather imperious schoolboy voice carries over the next few shots...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Personal for Tarr from Alleline... 230   INT. CIRCUS - ARCHIVE LIFT - NIGHT                         230 A shot of the archive room, of the lift full of secrets slowly being lowered into the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... require clarification before meeting your request... ON THE DOOR OF THE WAR-ROOM resolutely closed, a slither of light burning beneath it. 231   INT. TAILORS SHOP - NIGHT                                  231 The tailors dummies standing to attention, as alert as Mendel watching from the window, phone to mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Quote information vital to safeguarding of the Circus unquote does not qualify... 232   INT. PARIS - CYPHER ROOM - NIGHT                           232 Tarr has begun to laugh, gripped by a weird hilarity.    Ben reads even faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... send further information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the way Percy boy! You keep stalling. I better warn you Ben, there's some lousy people in this outfit. Don't trust a fucking one of them. 233   INT. SAFE HOUSE - LISTENING ROOM - NIGHT                   233 Smiley sits in the BLACKNESS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SMILEY'S P.O.V. The washing line extends ahead of him, glowing faintly white in the darkness. The tinny sound of Mendel's voice comes from the receiver beside him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Smiley... Smiley picks up the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here, Mendel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One's gone. Smiley puts the receiver back on the armchair. He goes to the window in his stockinged feet. 234   EXT. SAFE HOUSE - TOW PATH - NIGHT                          234 Guillam, nerves taut, sees three long flashes. The mole is coming. 235   EXT. SAFE HOUSE - NIGHT                                     235 A long silent look at the dark house. Then the star of light spilling into the darkness from the air vent. 236   INT. SAFE HOUSE - LISTENING ROOM - NIGHT                    236 Smiley, calm and contained, hears the sound of a CAB drawing up outside. A pair of footsteps on the path. Scrape of a key in the door. A pale rim of light appears around the kitchen door. And outside the sound of a second cab drawing up. Someone else enters the house. Movement in the kitchen. Two men's voices start to speak in Russian. Smiley gets up, GUN in one hand, and guided by the line, makes his way through the darkness to the door of the kitchen, groping, rather like a blind man walking towards the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is your cover story in case we are disturbed? The sound of ANOTHER voice answering in Russian from further back in the room. ON Smiley inching across the room. 237   INT. SAFE HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - NIGHT                    237 The tape recorder working...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This can be salvaged. Tarr can be found and liquidated. 238   EXT. SAFE HOUSE - TOW PATH - NIGHT                        238 Guillam waits. He turns, his nerves taut, searching the shadows for movement. For a moment he's certain he's being WATCHED. Then, from the house, the signal he's been waiting for. Three long flashes. Guillam starts to run. 239   EXT. SAFE HOUSE - TOW PATH - NIGHT                        239 A nervous Lacon is waiting on a corner, Guillam runs past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't have bloodshed. I want absolute calm! A cab appears and Mendel jumps out. Mendel and Lacon hurry towards the house, Guillam sprinting ahead. 240   INT. SAFE HOUSE - GROUND FLOOR - NIGHT                    240 CLOSE ON THE TAPE SPOOL - REVOLVING ... churning the SILENCE. The sounds of the house amplified. No one talking. Perhaps the faintest of coughs. 241   EXT. SAFE HOUSE - NIGHT                                   241 109. GUILLAM'S P.O.V. Racing towards the FRONT DOOR and bursting through, into the hallway and on up the stairs, taking them three at a time, bursting through into... 242   INT. SAFE HOUSE - MEETING ROOM - NIGHT                     242 An oddly formal scene. POLYAKOV stands pipe in hand. Smiley sits in a chair, GUN in hand. Absurdly, still in his STOCKING FEET. And opposite him sits BILL HAYDON. They all turn to look at Guillam who stands panting in the doorway. ON GUILLAM ... as his nerves and excitement and any hope he might have had of a sense of victory DRAINS AWAY, leaving him with just an odd sense of embarrassment and shame. 243   EXT. SARRATT - DAY                                         243 Nissan huts surround a cricket field. Two cadets run laps. Smiley walks towards one of the huts, stops as Alleline walks out. Alleline, a broken man, can barely look at him. With a nod he walks on. 244   EXT. SARRATT - NISSAN HUT - DAY                            244 An unshaven, exhausted Haydon stands outside the Sarratt building in a small fenced enclosure. We see Smiley walking towards him. He's brought a box of cigarettes. 245   INT. SARRATT - DAY                                         245 Haydon is weeping quietly but without emotion. Smiley offers Haydon the box of Cigarettes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was assured there would be no coercion. Haydon waves it away. Smiley hands him a clean handkerchief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's almost funny George. I know the Inquisitors little bag of tricks. I taught most of them. Don't mind the tears. Just a reaction. An over-reaction, if you like. Craddox says I'll be off in a few days. I keep thinking how I'm going to miss the cricket in Moscow. He weeps again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I rather hoped you would do a little light house-keeping for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a girl...Would you give her some money for me? Give her a good cover story. If it helps tell her I love her. It's all here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a boy too. Bung him a few quid to shut him up. Take it out of the reptile fund.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did have one or two questions. About Prideaux.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it! I got him back, didn't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes you did. That was good of you. (Beat) I'm surprised Karla didn't shoot him. Or do you think he held back out of delicacy towards you? No response. Smiley looks carefully at Haydon's profile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Prideaux come and see you before he left on his Hungarian mission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, as a matter of fact he did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To say what? Haydon stares at him. For the first time the tears seem real. Guilt and grief. He looks down. A long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (almost to himself) To warn you. Because he knew, deep down, it was you all along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did you. Haydon stares out, lost in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to pick a side George. It was an aesthetic choice as much as a moral one. The West has grown so very ugly, don't you think? Smiley doesn't answer. A moment of silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Karla ever consider having you take over the Circus? For a moment Haydon looks rattled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not his bloody office boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you then? Haydon turns to Smiley, a flash of hauteur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm someone who made his mark. Smiley watches him, feeling him shrink in stature before his eyes. Haydon lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Quietly) Is there anything you want me to pass on to Ann? For a moment Haydon looks genuinely puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that was nothing personal, George, I hope you understand that? Karla said you were good, the one we had to worry about. But you do have a blind spot. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reckoned if I was known to be Ann's lover you wouldn't be able to see me straight. And he was right, up to a point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up to a point. 246   INT. CONTROL'S FLAT - DAY                                   246 The flat is now empty, cleared of Control's possessions. Smiley looks around, places a CHESS PIECE on the piano. We see the piece bears the name HAYDON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Tailor." He walks away. 247   EXT. SMILEY'S HOUSE - DAY                                   247 George comes up his path, looking old and tired. 248   INT. SMILEY'S HOUSE - DAY                                   248 He stops still inside his doorway. The little figure on the console table is in the wrong position. Smiley puts his hand on it, but doesn't right it, listening to something from somewhere inside the house. A faint movement. Through the HALF OPEN KITCHEN DOOR we catch a glimpse of a WOMAN beyond. ANN is back. Smiley stands with his back to us, still in his coat, staring through the door at his wife beyond. Something of a Vermeer in the image. He's absorbing the different atmosphere - home. Deciding whether to go in. Or not. Suddenly we hear MUSIC - JULIO IGLESIAS, singing a disco version of LA MER - very seventies. CUT TO: 249   INT. CIRCUS - FIFTH FLOOR PARTY - NIGHT - PAST              249 The same lively Christmas PARTY at the Circus we saw earlier. BILL HAYDON, a little drunk and happy, works his way through the packed room, dancing to the Iglesias' track, a drink in each hand, a little tongue-in-cheek, singing along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HAYDON'S P.O.V. ... other members of the Circus glimpsed as we pass them - CONNIE SACHS, WESTERBY, BLAND, drunk, grinning at us. TOBY ESTERHASE talking to one of the SECRETARIES... The MUSIC continues as we find... CONTROL and SMILEY ...sitting a little apart, talking. Haydon is still working his way through the party... We PASS PERCY ALLELINE and his DRUNK WIFE. Alleline looking fretful and hoping no-one is noticing the scene she is making... Haydon grins at all his comrades, feeling fond of everyone, but heads on to his destination... PRIDEAUX sits watching him come with a drink towards him, shakes his head, but can't help but smile fondly at the idiot Haydon is prepared to make of himself... 250   OMITTED                                                  250 251   OMITTED                                                  251 252   OMITTED                                                  252 253   OMITTED                                                  253 254   EXT. SARRATT - EVENING - PRESENT                         254 The music continues as we see two cadets are running on the circuit, their white t-shirts only just visible in the dark. Haydon sits on his bench, smoking, watching them flit by. He smiles to himself, remembering. He senses something, turns and looks back. Prideaux stands in the shadows behind him, some fifteen foot away. The two men stare at each other, then Haydon turns back to watch the runners. We HOLD CLOSE on his face as Prideaux approaches, the only sound the soft wind and his hushed footsteps growing loser. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like us Jim. (Beat) Best days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A rifle is placed on the side of his head - the same execution shot that we saw used on Irina - the force blowing him sideways out of the frame. As the music continues we... CUT TO: 255     EXT. SARRATT - DAWN                                         255 Frost on the grass. We find a CADET staring down at the corpse of Haydon leaning against the back of the bench, outlined in silver frost. The music ends. 256     INT. PRIDEAUX'S CARAVAN - DAY                               256 Prideaux sits on his bed. From outside - the sound of a football game. Someone taps on the door. Low. Taps again. Prideaux, coiled with grief and anger, suddenly gets up. 257     EXT. PRIDEAUX'S CARAVAN - DAY                               257 Roach stands in the doorway, carrying a gift - a boot- scrape made in woodwork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made you something. Prideaux stares at the boot scrape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want you hanging around here. Keep away from me from now on. Go and join the others. Roach stands frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just bloody join in. Go and play damn you. He watches Roach walk to the edge of the field and stand mutely at the side. A ball rolls towards him. Roach goes to kick it. Misses. He tries again, RUNNING OUT OF SHOT. 257aA   EXT. PARIS DEPARTMENT STORE - EVENING                     257aA Tarr is walking through a busy street. He stops to light a cigarette. A woman in a YELLOW dress appears, reflected in the glass. She's holding the hands of two children. For a moment it looks like Irina.
direction.name: direction

ON THE DOOR OF THE WAR-ROOM
